info.title: Opkit
info.description:
The fastest, easiest way to integrate with health insurance.

Opkit is a modern, easy-to-use developer toolkit for healthcare payments. We provide simple APIs for verifying insurance and submitting health insurance claims.

To get started, see here.

post.description:
Create a new widget submission.

A widget submission represents an instance of the widget form being submitted by a user.

payer_id.description:
The ID of a payer.

You can get a list of payer IDs from the getPayers endpoint.

get.description: Get a list of your existing widget configurations.

schema.description: An object containing a list of widget configurations and a count that indicates the number of items in the list.

count.description: The number of items in this list.

post.description:
Create a new plan acceptance rule.

When evaluated, a plan acceptance rule determines whether the customer organization is considered in-network or out-of-network for an individual's health insurance based on the plan's type, the individual's state of residence, and the insurance company that offers the plan.

payer_id.description:
The ID of a payer.

You can get a list of payer IDs from the getPayers endpoint.

get.description: Get a list of your existing plan acceptance rules.

schema.description: An object containing a list of plan acceptance rules  and a count that indicates the number of items in the list.

count.description: The number of items in this list.

items.description: A list of plan acceptance rules.

delete.description: Delete one of your existing plan acceptance rules by ID.

parameters.name: id

schema.description: The ID of the plan acceptance rule.

parameters.description: The ID of the plan acceptance rule.

post.description: Create a new plan acceptance check. This resource is used to determine whether a plan is considered in-network according to the customer organization's plan acceptance rules.

payer_id.description:
The ID of the payer to whom this plan belongs.

You can get a list of payer IDs from the getPayers endpoint.

For more on finding the appropriate payer ID, see here.

post.description:
Create a new eligibility inquiry for this payer, provider, and subscriber.

The response will contain information about the subscriber's plan, including the status and any associated benefits. Or, if the inquiry was rejected, it will include errors returned by the clearinghouse or payer.

requestBody.description: A payload with the ID of the payer you are issuing the inquiry to, the NPI of the provider you are issuing the inquiry on behalf of, the subscriber's insurance information, and the services you are inquiring about.

schema.description: An object that containing information about the subscriber you are inquiring about, the health insurance carrier (or "payer") you are issuing the inquiry to, and the provider you are issuing the inquiry on behalf of.

payer_id.description:
The ID of the payer you are inssuing the inquiry to.

You can get a list of payer IDs from the getPayers endpoint.

For more on finding the appropriate payer ID, see here.

provider_npi.description:
A valid National Provider Identifier (NPI).

This can be the NPI of an organization or an individual.

services.description:
A list of services to return benefits for. The eligibility response will only contain benefits relating to the services in this list.

If you are unsure about which service or services to specify, see here.

get.description: Get a list of your existing eligibility inquiries.

schema.description: An object containing a list of eligibility inquiries  and a count that indicates the number of items in the list.

count.description: The number of items in this list.

get.description: Get one of your existing eligibility inquiries by ID.

parameters.name: id

schema.description: The ID of the eligibility inquiry.

parameters.description: The ID of the eligibility inquiry.

get.description:
Get a complete list of the payers supported by Opkit.

This endpoint returns a list payers that you can interact with via the Opkit API. Opkit supports hundreds of payers across the United States.

parameters.name: search

schema.description: A substring to match payer names on. The casing of this value does not matter.

parameters.description: A substring to match payer names on. The casing of this value does not matter.

schema.description: An object containing a list of payers and a count that indicates the number of items in this list.

count.description: The number of items in this list.

post.summary: Register a new organization and create basic resources
post.description:
Create a new customer user and organization along with various organization-level resources, including API keys and a widget configuration.

This endpoint is for Opkit internal use only and will return unauthorized for customer API keys. Please do not attempt to access it.

requestBody.description:
A payload containing the full name to use for the new customer user, the email address to use for the new customer user, and (optionally) the name to use for the new customer organization.

If customer_organization_name is absent, the server will use a default value for the new customer organization name.

schema.description:
An object containing the full name to use for the new customer user, the email address to use for the new customer user, and (optionally) the name to use for the new customer organization.

If customer_organization_name is absent, the server will use a default value for the new customer organization name.

customer_user_name.description: The full name to use for the new customer user.

customer_user_email.description: The email address to use for the new customer user.

customer_organization_name.description: The name to use for the new customer organization. If this field is not provided, the server will use a default value for the customer organization name.

schema.description:
An object containing various fields from the new customer user, customer organization, and API key.

This object will contain the secret value of the API key, which should NEVER be shared publicly.

api_keys.description: A list of API key objects. This list should contain two items: a public API key and a private API key.

PlanAcceptanceRuleEffect.description: An enum that describes whether a plan acceptance rule is inclusionary or exclusionary.

PlanType.description: An enum that describes health insurance plan types.

Service.description:
An enum that describes medical goods and services.

You must supply one or more services when performing an eligibility inquiry. The services you choose determine the benefits that are included in the response.

"health_benefit_plan_coverage" is a generic service that covers general benefits, such as a plan's overall deductible. This is a convention of the health insurance industry.

EligibilityInquiryError.description:
An object representing an eligibility inquiry error.

An eligibility inquiry error is an error that is returned by either the clearinghouse or payer. This is is distinct from HTTP 4XX and 5XX errors, which are returned by Opkit's servers.

Usually, an eligibility inquiry error occurs when there was a problem with the subscriber's insurance information. For example, a payer may return an error if the subscriber's member ID was not recognized.

source.description: An enum that describes the source of the eligibility inquiry error.

BenefitCoverage.description: An enum that describes a benefit's level of coverage.

BenefitPeriod.description: An enum that describes benefit time period.

Benefit.description:
An object that represents a discrete benefit.

A benefit is a feature of the subscriber's insurance plan. For example, the plan may include a $100 co-pay for in-network physician office visits.

The benefit object is polymorphic and may contain different fields depending on the service, type, coverage_level, and other factors.

You can determine whether a subscriber is eligible to receive a certain medical service under their insurance plan by reviewing the list of benefits that are included in the eligibility inquiry response body.

name.description:
A semi-unique name that describes this particular benefit.

This value is derived from other characteristics of the benefit, specifically the benefit's type, network, coverage, and period.

Note that names are not unique across services. Two benefits with different services may share the same name.

values.description:
A list of benefit values.

Some benefits may have more than one value, although this is uncommon.

messages.description: A list of messages that were included by the payer as additional information for this benefit.

name.description: The name of the customer customer organization.

ApiKey.description: An object representing an API key. This can be a public or secret key.

type.description: An enum that describes the type of a benefit value.

BenefitValueQualifier.description:
An enum that appears alongside benefit values of type "quantity".

This enum indicates the nature of the quantity. In most cases, this will be the units.

BenefitValueStatus.description: An enum that appears in the "value" field of a benefit value.

payer_id.description:
The ID of a payer.

This field may be undefined if the widget submission was created without a payer.

plan_id.description:
The ID of a plan.

This field may be undefined if the widget submission was created without a plan.

benefits.description:
A list of benefits returned by the payer.

This list will be empty if result is inactive or unknown.

PostPlanAcceptanceChecksResponse.description:
The response to a postPlanAcceptanceChecks request.

This object contains the results of a plan acceptance check, which should indicate whether the plan provided is considered in-network according to the customer organization's plan acceptance rules.

in_network.description: A boolean value indicating whether the plan is considered in-network.

EligibilityInquiry.description:
A request for information from a payer about a health insurance policy's coverages, typically in relation to a particular subscriber.

This object contains the results of an eligibility inquiry, including any benefits returned by the payer - or, if the inquiry was rejected for some reason, any errors returned by the clearinghouse and/or payer.

benefits.description:
A list of benefits returned by the payer.

THIS LIST IS NOT COMPREHENSIVE. The benefits that appear in this list are determined by the services specified in the request payload.

There are some benefits that do not relate to a specific medical service. For example, the plan's overall deductible. These "general benefits" will appear under the "health_benefit_plan_coverage" service. This is a convention in the health insurance industry.

errors.description:
A list of eligibility inquiry errors.

An eligibility inquiry error is an error that is returned by either the clearinghouse or payer. This list may contain error items if the eligibility inquiry was created successfully but rejected by either the clearinghouse or payer.

Payer.description: A health insurance carrier that offers one or more health insurance plans.

plans.description: A list of plans belonging to this payer.

Subscriber.description:
An individual who is covered under a health insurance plan.

This should be the primary insurance holder - not a dependent. Opkit does not currently support eligibility inquiries for dependents.

first_name.description: The subscriber's first name as it appears on their insurance card.

last_name.description: The subscriber's last name as it appears on their insurance card.

member_id.description: The subscriber's member ID as it appears on their insurance card.

date_of_birth.description:
The subscriber's date of birth as it appears on their insurance card.

This should be formatted like 01-01-2021.

BenefitNetwork.description: An enum that describes a benefit's network status.

WidgetConfiguration.description: An object containing configuration settings for the Opkit widget.

customer_organization_name.description: The name of the customer organization that owns this widget configuration.

referral_url.description: A URL that determines where widget users are sent when they click a call-to-action button.

ErrorCode.description: An error code indicating the category of problem.

Error.description: An object that is returned when an error has occured. This includes both client- and server-side errors.

message.description: A brief text description that expands upon this particular error code.

Default.description:
A default error response if no other response is provided.

If you see this response, it should be accompanied by a 4XX HTTP status code. You can use the error code to programmatically handle the error.

5XX responses are unanticipated will not include an error object in the response body. You should try resubmitting the request.

BasicAuth.description:
Opkit authenticates requests using HTTP Basic Auth.

Basic Auth usually involves two values: a username and password. In Opkit's case, you should provide your API key as the username. You do not need to provide a password.

Therefore, your requests should include the following header: "Authorization: Basic <base64-encode(your-api-key-with-a-trailing-colon)>".

For more information, see here.
